item.description:
Hi folks! Up until now, our work has focused on developing specific skills needed for improvisation. Knowledge of status indicators, mime technique, and character development, form part of the improviser's toolbox. We'll continue to work on internalizing these skills.

Without some context regarding the goals and values of improv, it is difficult to use our tools effectively. We'll talk a bit about concepts and ideas to keep in mind when improvising.

For the bulk of rehearsal, we will do several fun, exciting games. These games will be of the variety we can expect to perform for our audiences. Advance warning: we'll be warming up with some bibbity, bibbity, bop (I promise to make it sensible this time).

See you Friday!
Harish

group.name: Great Boston Chapter of Laughing Matter - Auditions Circle

item.name: Meeting 5: The Art of Improv
